meanings.definition: A solid piece of hard material, such as wood or stone.
meanings.sent1: I built a small block tower with colorful wooden blocks.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker carried a heavy block of stone to the building site.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her toy block was a magical gemstone.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a heavy block of ice after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The block of chocolate was so big, it lasted the whole week.

meanings.sent1: The fallen tree created a block in the middle of the road.
meanings.sent2: She overcame the writer's block by taking a short walk outside.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door acted like a block to their escape plan.
meanings.sent4: Fear can sometimes be a mental block preventing us from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The huge boulder was a massive block in their path up the mountain.

meanings.definition: A group of buildings bounded by streets.
meanings.sent1: The city block had a mix of shops and apartments.
meanings.sent2: The kids played basketball on the block until sunset.
meanings.sent3: The block party brought together all the neighbors for a fun evening.
meanings.sent4: The historic block was filled with old Victorian-style houses.
meanings.sent5: The office block was bustling with activity during the workday.
